clinical_study.brief_title: Pulsed Dye Laser Treatment of Recent Surgical Scars
clinical_study.official_title: Pulsed Dye Laser Treatment of Recent Surgical Scars: A Prospective Single Blinded Within Patient Controlled Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypothesis: Improvement of recent surgical scars after treatment with 595nm Pulsed dye laser treatments.
Study design: Prospective single blinded within patient controlled randomised trial. Recent surgical scars of at least 5cm will be divided into 2 parts and randomized. 1 part will be treated with 4 595nm Pulsed dye laser treatments on a 4 weeks interval. The other part will serve as a within patient control. 1 and 6 months after the intervention both parts of the scar will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Physician global assessment for the treated and control region (PhGA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start of the study, 1 and 6 months after treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Patient global assessment for the treated and control region (PGA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before start of the study, 1 and 6 months after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of scar color by colorimetry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before start of the study, 1 and 6 months after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of scar tickness by ultrasound measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before start of the study, 1 and 6 months after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of viscoelasticity by Cutometer measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before start of the study, 1 and 6 months after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical scar assessment by the Vancouver Scar scale and POSAS scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before the start of the PDL treatment, and 1 and 6 months after the last treatment.

intervention.description: Part 1 of the surgical scar will be treated with 4 595nm Pulsed dye laser treatments.
Part 2 of the surgical scar will serve as a within patient control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with planned surgical intervention leaving a scar from at least 5 cm in an area prone to hypertrophic scarring : neck, shoulders, chest, mandibular angle and extremities
- Age at least 18 years old.
- Patient able and willing to give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with planned surgical intervention on hands, feet and genital area
- Patients with a history of photodermatoses
- Patients with a history of keloids
- Patients with a history of adverse outcomes related to PDL
